title: Growing agriculture with big data: Alex Ball Meat & Livestock Australia

tasks.task: Attend a presentation on agricultural data and decision-making.
subtasks: Move around during the presentation.
Challenge the usefulness of big data.
Emphasize the need for transforming big data into big decisions.
Discuss changes in livestock industry towards more brand-driven production.
Address the shift from visual to information-driven agriculture.
Highlight the role of emerging technologies like sensors and Fitbits in livestock management.
Explain the use of objective measurements and genetics in animal information.
Discuss the challenges of handling large amounts of data in agricultural decision-making.
Highlight the importance of consumer data in meat quality assessment.
Mention the potential for drone technology and biological tattoos in monitoring animal welfare.
Discuss the transition from farm managers to systems engineers in agricultural roles.
Address the complexities and potential for optimization in supply chain integration.
Highlight the role of MLA and other organizations in managing agricultural databases.
Advocate for integration and standardization across different agricultural sectors.
Discuss the challenges of data compliance and its impact on the livestock industry.
Present examples of successful data-driven initiatives in other countries.
Emphasize the importance of open-source algorithms and aggregation for decision-making.
Discuss the need for a cultural shift towards valuing algorithms over data.
Highlight the challenges producers face in transitioning to data-driven decision-making.
Conclude by emphasizing the importance of big decisions over big data.
